008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.ij;
010
011import ij.plugin.filter.Convolver;
012import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
013
014/**
015 * Defines static methods for filtering images based on ImageJ's {@link Convolver} class. 
016 * None of the filter methods modifies the kernel, i.e., kernels are 
017 * used as supplied and never normalized.
018 * 
019 * @author WB
020 * @version 2020-02-19
021 * @see Convolver
022 */
023public abstract class Filter {
024        
025        private Filter() {}
026
027        /**
028         * Applies a one-dimensional convolution kernel to the given image,
029         * which is modified. The 1D kernel is applied in horizontal direction only.#
030         * The supplied filter kernel is not normalized.
031         * 
032         * @param fp the image to be filtered (modified)
033         * @param h the filter kernel
034         */
035        public static void convolveX (ImageProcessor fp, float[] h) {
036                Convolver conv = new Convolver();
037                conv.setNormalize(false);
038                conv.convolve(fp, h, h.length, 1);
039        }
040
041        /**
042         * Applies a one-dimensional convolution kernel to the given image,
043         * which is modified. The 1D kernel is applied in vertical direction only.
044         * The supplied filter kernel is not normalized.
045         * 
046         * @param fp the image to be filtered (modified)
047         * @param h the filter kernel
048         */
049        public static void convolveY (ImageProcessor fp, float[] h) {
050                Convolver conv = new Convolver();
051                conv.setNormalize(false);
052                conv.convolve(fp, h, 1, h.length);
053        }
054
055        /**
056         * Applies a one-dimensional convolution kernel to the given image,
057         * which is modified.
058         * The 1D kernel is applied twice, once in horizontal and once in
059         * vertical direction.
060         * The supplied filter kernel is not normalized.
061         * 
062         * @param fp the image to be filtered (modified)
063         * @param h the filter kernel
064         */
065        public static void convolveXY (ImageProcessor fp, float[] h) {
066                Convolver conv = new Convolver();
067                conv.setNormalize(false);
068                conv.convolve(fp, h, h.length, 1);
069                conv.convolve(fp, h, 1, h.length);
070        }
071
072}
